intro: Austroliabum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hop萧, is a shrub native to the southern regions of Australia. It features small, elliptical leaves that are typically narrow and have a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Austroliabum is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is used in traditional Indigenous medicine and has some ornamental value in gardens.
